data.prayer: Lord, for the leaders in the state of Quinara, let the eyes of their hearts be enlightened in order that they may know the hope to which they are called.
data.verse: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people, and his incomparably great power for us who believe.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Quinara, Guinea-Bissau
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, renew the call of John the Baptist in the state of Quinara. Send out bold servants who will call all to repent.
data.verse: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 48 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Quinara unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Quinara access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

data.prayer: Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Nalu people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Nalu people.
Father, let the threatened of Quinara, Guinea-Bissau know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.prayer: Father, comfort those who mourn in Quinara, Guinea-Bissau.
data.verse: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

data.prayer: Lord, to the people of Quinara you say, "If you wait for Me, I will work on your behalf."
data.verse: For from of old men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen a God besides you, who works for him who waits for him.

location.name: Quinara
location.people_groups_list: Arab, Syrian, Papel, Balanta, Kentohe, Mankanya, Biafada
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Arab, Syrian (1,500), Papel (174,000), Balanta, Kentohe (392,000), Mankanya (56,000), Biafada (57,000)
